Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply. I wll continue exercising. In fact I ran 2.5 miles yesterday. I was running 13 miles before I got sick....It's a start. I see my oncologist today so i'll see what she says. Thanks again for the encouraging words.
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content:
Hi,
Thanks for your response. I work with a personal trainer just so I won't overdo it. I know many people who take Arimidex do experience muscle pain. I am pretty careful about
 my exercise. Massage does sound good!
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content:
Hi,
I finished my cancer treatment in May of 2006. I began taking Arimidex in June. At first I was fine. My energy was good and I felt like me! After about
 a month, I noticed some neck and back pain. I also feel tired and a little depressed. I have always been very active and am having trouble running and workingout. Is there someting I can take to combat these side effects or another drug I could opt for? Neannie
Posts.Title: Arimidex

Posts.Content: Thanks for your response. I see my doctor today so I'll mention the aromsin and see what she says. Is it as effective as arimidex? What was your diagnosis?
Posts.Title: Arimidex
